opportunities.description: Across Canada, regional development agencies support small and medium-sized businesses and foster innovation. In Budget 2024, the Federal Government allocated C$200 million in funding for development agencies to support AI adoption in Canada's ...

opportunities.title: Empowering Innovation: Intellectual Property Funding Opportunities in Canada 2.0 | Cassels.com
opportunities.description: With regard to the ability to earn an ITC, some Canadian controlled private corporations (CCPC), and the 2025 Budget, some eligible Canadian public corporations, are entitled to earn an enhanced ITC rate of 35% on their first $3 million dollars of qualifying SR&ED expenditure in the year (the expenditure limit) which increases to an annual SR&ED qualifying expenditure limit of $4.5 million following December 16, 2024 and, under the 2025 Budget, up to an annual expenditure limit of $6 million following December 16, 2024.

opportunities.description: In general, IRAP funds are capped around $150,000, with exceptions made on a case by case basis. ... This sub-program offers small grants of up to $50,000 for the commercialization or research and development of technology projects.

opportunities.description: The NRC IRAP provides up to $10 ... Eligible activities include research and development aimed at developing and commercializing new or improved products, services, or processes....

opportunities.title: Is Your Industry Eligible for Tax Credits?
opportunities.description: Understanding which industries qualify for tax credits can significantly impact a business’s financial health. This article will explore the eligibility criteria for different tax credits in Canada, focusing on the Scientific Research and Experimental Development (SR&ED) Tax Credit, Multimedia Tax Credit, E-Business Tax Credit, and other funding opportunities.

opportunities.title: CDN | SR&ED 101 Guide | Landing Page
opportunities.description: Ryan’s SR&ED 101 Guide helps you gain a solid understanding of how your business can leverage the SR&ED tax credit program with essential information on how to get started.

opportunities.title: SR&ED tax credits - are you eligible? | Swoop Canada
opportunities.description: Keep in mind, you do not get to claim 100% of these expenses. Canadian Controlled Private Corporations (CCPCs) are generally able to claim about 64% of salaries or wages, and about 32% of subcontractor fees. For materials, the percentage of costs covered is about 42%. The permitted claims for non-CCPC are roughly half of these amounts. The SR&ED program offers a tax credit at a basic rate of 15% on qualified expenditures.

Businesses with a signed grant agreement to CDAP’s Boost Your Business Technology stream prior to February 19, 2024 may be eligible to receive a grant2 to build their digital plan, followed by a 0% loan of up to $100,0001 to implement it...

opportunities.title: About the Canada Digital Adoption Program (CDAP)
opportunities.description: The Canada Digital Adoption Program is no longer accepting new applications. CDAP offers two grants that will help you get online and use technology to build your business.

tax_incentives.title: Scientific Research and Experimental Development (SR&ED) tax incentives - Canada.ca
tax_incentives.description: Claimants should submit their SR&ED claim with their income tax return for the year.

tax_incentives.title: What work is eligible - Scientific Research and Experimental Development (SR&ED) tax incentives - Canada.ca
tax_incentives.description: Learn about the requirements for SR&ED eligibility, including what types of research and development work qualify for tax incentives and what is excluded. Get support through self-assessment tools, pre-claim consultations, and guidelines.

tax_incentives.title: Scientific Research and Experimental Development (SR&ED) tax incentives - Canada.ca
tax_incentives.description: The Scientific Research and Experimental Development (SR&ED) tax incentive program lets Canadian businesses earn tax incentives that can reduce their income tax payable.

tax_incentives.title: What are SR&ED tax incentives - Scientific Research and Experimental Development (SR&ED) tax incentives - Canada.ca
tax_incentives.description: Other government R&D funding and assistance will not prevent your work from being eligible for SR&ED tax incentives, but they will reduce the amount of ITC you can earn.

tax_incentives.title: Line 41200 – Investment tax credit - Canada.ca
tax_incentives.description: You can carry forward credits earned in tax years ending after 1997 for up to 20 years by filling in Part F of Form T2038(IND) and filing it with your paper return. You may be able to claim a refund of your unused ITCs. For more information, go to Line 45400 – Refund of investment tax credit.

tax_incentives.title: Clean Technology Manufacturing Investment Tax Credit - Canada.ca
tax_incentives.description: The Clean Technology Manufacturing ITC, also known as CTM, is a refundable tax credit to encourage the investment of capital for clean technology manufacturing and processing, as well as critical mineral extraction and processing in Canada from January 1, 2024, to December 31, 2034.

quick_wins.title: Boost Your Business Technology Grant | Get up to $15,000
quick_wins.description: Propel your business forward. Find the right technologies for your business and build a digital adoption plan with a grant of up to $15,000.

quick_wins.title: Canada Digital Adoption Program (CDAP)
quick_wins.description: Businesses with a signed grant agreement to CDAP’s Boost Your Business Technology stream prior to February 19, 2024 may be eligible to receive a grant2 to build their digital plan, followed by a 0% loan of up to $100,0001 to implement it.

quick_wins.title: Ontario Grants - Digital Main Street
quick_wins.description: is focused on providing one-on-one assistance to small businesses in any region of Ontario. It will include training, advisory support, and a grant to support the Digital Service Squads across Ontario.

quick_wins.title: Programs for Ontario buisnesses - Digital Main Street
quick_wins.description: Ontario Grants Program: provided brick-and-mortar small businesses with $2,500 Digital Transformation Grants, and municipalities / local communities with grants to implement a Digital Service Squad.

quick_wins.title: Google for Startups Accelerator: Canada
quick_wins.description: A ten-week accelerator program for high potential Seed to Series A tech startups based in Canada.

quick_wins.title: Programs - Google for Startups
quick_wins.description: From Accelerator to our Funds, discover the Google for Startups programs that can help your business move forward.

quick_wins.title: Productivity and Innovation Voucher Program | Nova Scotia Business Inc.
quick_wins.description: There are two tiers of the Productivity and Innovation Voucher Program. Tier 1: Vouchers of up to $15,000 for eligible businesses that have not previously been awarded a voucher or are applying with a new project.

quick_wins.title: Innovation Voucher Program | Empowering Ontario's Businesses
quick_wins.description: Be a for-profit company with a valid Canada Revenue Agency business number · Be from Northern, Rural, or Indigenous communities, or be a business at least 50% owned and led by an equity deserving group as defined by the Employment Equity Act: Women, LGBTQ2+ Canadians, Indigenous peoples, Black and racialized Canadians, persons with disabilities, and other under-represented groups · Have a challenge to overcome in bringing a commercializable innovation to market or improving an existing product
